title: Salmon fish fingers with harissa crumb
directions: 1 Preheat the oven to 200°C/fan 180°C/gas mark 6. Cut the ciabatta into rough pieces and place in a food processor. Blitz until you have course textured breadcrumbs. Transfer to a bowl and add the flat-leaf parsley, harissa and lemon zest. Stir well so all the crumbs are evenly coated with the harissa paste.

2 Place the flour and breadcrumbs on two separate plates, and the egg in a shallow bowl. Dip each piece of salmon first in the flour, then in the egg, and finally the breadcrumbs, turning continuously until the whole finger is well coated. Transfer to a lined baking tray and repeat with the rest of the fillets. Chill the fingers for 15-20 minutes to firm up, then bake for 12-15 minutes, until crispy.
3 Meanwhile, mix together the mayo and lemon juice and season with black pepper. Serve the fish fingers with the mayo on the side.
ingredients: 1 side of salmon, skin removed and cut into fingers
